column5: Hey folks.  I need a battery for a Cuda 168 fishfinder.  This is not a portable unit but I want to be able to take it in and out of the small boat any time.  So I plan on checking the battery in a box in the boat to be removed when not in use.  Any ideas what I should get?  Oh and I'm not going to go with then over kill and bug $$ eaither...  thanks...

12 Volt, 7 Amp Gell cell with a charger, available at the large fishing stores or any good battery shop, like this: www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/ProductDisplay?storeId=10151&catalogId=10001&langId=-1&partNumber=30289&hvarTarget=search&cmCat=SearchResults
And Canadian Tire has a 12V 1AMP charger on sale this week for $10. Great for this battery.
Cdn Tire also have 12 volt motorcycle size batteries on sale this week...  I use one to run my bilge pump and/or run a stern light at night...
I get my 12v, 7Ah batteries at Osso electric. They have locations all over the place. Around $30, and your all set. Small and effective. I can run for several days on one battery.  Sinker

Where abouts are you?  Sayal (in the GTA) has all kinds of Gell Cells, and they don't charge more than about $25 for the bigger ones.  Smaller ones around $8.  I've bought batteries for my portable fishfinder, Aquavu and 2meg flashlight there.  About a quarter the price of anywhere else.  http://www.sayal.com/ActionContacts.asp
